title: riskyduck24
author: riskyduck24
created_time: February 06, 2023, 11:29:23 PMLast edit: February 06, 2023, 11:39:55 PM by riskyduck24
content: I sent  4000 USD loan to Goku88 and this guy falsely accuse me of  being multi without any avidence.Later on Goku attached screenshot of his wallet there. (He said that it´s randonm txid from the ethereum network)And it was proven that it´s not. This kinda upsetting when he abuses he power to give false rep and put down people. I only trying to make good business here.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5438426.0ARCHIEVEhttps://web.archive.org/web/20230206233311/https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5438426.0

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.created_time: February 06, 2023, 11:55:54 PMLast edit: February 07, 2023, 01:04:46 AM by Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: 10:34:55 PM ---> goku88 seeks for a loan of 2.5 ETH10:48:23 PM ---> riskyduck24 sends ETH to goku88 without even knowing his ETH address. The post had a BTC address10:49:49 PM ---> goku88 edits BTC address to ETH address10:50:32 PM ---> riskyduck24 woke up10:52:55 PM ---> riskyduck24 Posts the tx ID claiming he had sent the money to goku88How does one wake up and send ETH to an address that hasn't even be posted or edited yet?There is only one answer, Goku88=riskyduck24DireWolfM14's tag is justified.

Maybe you think about that we can use PM? Maybe I explain OP that i don´t use BTC?Take an IQ test urgently. https://iqtest.com/

comments.author: avp2306
comments.body: Seems weird scenario has been created on my mindIf the transaction became successful then either goku or you might have a proof of transaction saying you lend some money to someone or either goku have proof of payment to show to the lender you have proof of that transaction.Then either goku or you will ask another big loan to different lender and after successful getting a loan to unfortunate lender then possible loan default might happen.Hopefully I'm wrong with this speculation.Seems @Direwolf got a good catch here so I think this one deserve a neg tag.

comments.author: MuffinMaster
comments.body: Quote from: avp2306 on February 07, 2023, 02:19:51 AMSeems weird scenario has been created on my mindIf the transaction became successful then either goku or you might have a proof of transaction saying you lend some money to someone or either goku have proof of payment to show to the lender you have proof of that transaction.Then either goku or you will ask another big loan to different lender and after successful getting a loan to unfortunate lender then possible loan default might happen.Hopefully I'm wrong with this speculation.Seems @Direwolf got a good catch here so I think this one deserve a neg tag.I fully agree with you. I described this scenario in the thread where the whole loan action took place:Quote from: MuffinMaster on February 07, 2023, 01:34:43 AMThe only reason I can think of is that he wanted to start creating a positive credit history for the @goku88 account. Probably after 2-3 "repaid" fake loans, there would be an attempt to take a real loan from someone without collateral, because "saiyan people have word of a stone."   , but of course he would simply disappear with the borrowed money.He got a lesson and learned not to make stupid mistakes. He will for sure try again, so this is example why everyone should be wary of loans without collateral.I think that's the most likely thing what Mr. Fraudster wanted to do.

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: Quote from: riskyduck24 on February 07, 2023, 01:55:13 AMMany things  bitcoin arena told told are are made up.  Yeah, you can see why I misunderstood this pea-brain's post above.  There's no way in hell this joker's going to win any argument in English--or any other language for that matter since the facts are against him all the way.  All I can see is him dodging everyone's pointed barbs with insults and idiocy.Quote from: riskyduck24 on February 07, 2023, 01:55:13 AMDon´t talk about  other careers. Your  getting few cents for posts, I always loved that rebuttal, "few cents".  That exact combination of words has been used to describe members in sig campaigns posting in threads like this, where someone got snared in their own trap.  OP, you might be filthy rich and consider $6 to be a few cents (that's for Chipmixer participants), but I'm thinking that you're just bitter or don't know how much campaigns actually pay.  Either way, none of that is helping you convince anyone about anything.  I'm telling you, just lock this thread up because all you're going to get is more of the same.

I am trying to defend this hopeless high IQ dude who is lost in a world full of brainless attackers!  I mean, we just don't get him perhaps?
